text: Harare Central is a constituency represented in the National Assembly of the Parliament of Zimbabwe. It is located in the central area of Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe. Like all Zimbabwean constituencies, Harare Central elects one Member of Parliament (MP) by the first-past-the-post electoral system. The seat has been represented by Movement for Democratic Change MP Murisi Zwizwai since a 2003 by-election. == Members of Parliament == {| class="wikitable" ! colspan="2" |Election !Member !Party ! |- | style="background-color: " | |1995 |Florence Chitauro |ZANU–PF | |- | style="background-color: " | |2000 |Mike Auret |MDC | |- | rowspan="5" style="background-color: " | |2003 | rowspan="5" |Murisi Zwizwai | rowspan="2" |MDC | |- |2005 | |- |2008 |MDC–T | |- |2013 |MDC–T | |- |2018 |MDC A | |- |} == See also == * List of Zimbabwean parliamentary constituencies == References == Category:Harare Category:Parliamentary constituencies in Zimbabwe
